instructions: From the Home screen, swipe up on an empty spot to open the Apps tray. Tap Messages > Menu > Settings > Emergency alert settings. Tap Emergency alerts, then tap to enable or disable the following: Imminent extreme alert Imminent severe alert AMBER alerts Public safety alert State and local alerts

From the Home screen, swipe up on an empty spot to open the Apps tray. Tap Email > Menu > Settings > Manage accounts . Tap your email address until it advances to the next screen, Scroll to NOTIFICATION SETTINGS . Tap Email notifications to select or clear the check box and turn on/off email notifications. Tap Notification sound to select or change the notification sound. Tap Vibrate to select or clear the check box and turn on or turn off vibrate notification.

From the Home screen, swipe up on an empty spot to open the Apps tray. Tap Settings > Sounds and vibration . Tap Ringtone , then select desired ringtone. Tap the back arrow in the upper left corner, the selection is automatically saved
From the Home screen, swipe up on an empty spot to open the Apps tray. Tap Contacts , then select the desired contact. Tap Edit > V iew more Tap Ringtone, select desired ringtone, then tap ADD .

Image titled Enable JavaScript Step 1 1 Open Chrome. It's a red, green, yellow, and blue spherical icon. Image titled Enable JavaScript Step 2 2 Tap . This icon is in the top-right corner of the screen. Image titled Enable JavaScript Step 3 3 Tap . It's near the bottom of the drop-down menu. Image titled Enable JavaScript Step 4 4 Scroll down and tap . It's about halfway down the page. Image titled Enable JavaScript Step 5 5 Tap . This option is near the middle of the Site Settings page. Image titled Enable JavaScript Step 6 6 Tap the grey switch. It will slide right and turn blue or green Image titled Android7systemswitchon2.png . Doing so enables JavaScript on your Android's Chrome browser. Note: If the JavaScript switch is blue or green, JavaScript is already enabled. Advertisement

Image titled Enable JavaScript Step 15 1 Open your iPhone's Settings Image titled Iphonesettingsappicon.png . It's a grey group of gears on the Home Screen. Image titled Enable JavaScript Step 16 2 Scroll down and tap . This option is roughly halfway down the Settings page. There's a blue Safari icon on the left side of this option. Image titled Enable JavaScript Step 17 3 Scroll all the way down and tap . It's at the bottom of the screen. Image titled Enable JavaScript Step 18 4 Slide the white JavaScript Image titled Iphoneswitchofficon.png switch right. It will turn green Image titled Iphoneswitchonicon1.png . Doing so enables JavaScript on your iPhone's Safari browser. Tip: You may need to close and re-open Safari in order for JavaScript to start working. Advertisement
